column5: Update order statuses & integrate AD numbers
column7:
Expected order process & statuses: 

1. Customer requests the order in the eShop
● Status = Waiting for Approval 
2. Order gets replicated in QAD
3. Customer service amends the order in QAD (adds products, adjusts quantities, adds freight fees, adds discount at header level...) and marks order as confirmed (they have to go through actions on the QAD browse to confirm it, they can't just tick the box)
4. Customer has to confirm / reject the order on the order detail page (they get notified by email) --> This step is specific to export
5. When customer has confirmed the order but the AD number is not yet generated --> This step is specific to export as well
● Status = In Progress
6. AD number gets manually created in QAD by Bev (AD is everything related to shipping)
● Status = Picking
● AD = Bill of Lading in QAD, see screenshots 3 and 4
● We should show the AD number that we can find at line level in QAD on the order detail page, see screenshot 3
● 1 order can have multiple AD numbers, but there is only 1 AD number open per shipment --> Once the products are picked and the shipment is complete then the existing AD number disappears and the next AD number can be created (against a back order for example)
● 1 AD number can have multiple orders
● We won't be able to test this in UAT because it's linked to QAD TEST and Bev is not able to generate the AD number in QAD test, also we have to generate the AD number through the application and we cannot do it through the WEB UI so we will even have to ask Bev for help when testing on PROD
7. Financial invoice number gets generated once the order has been processed through TMS and then posted by the accounts team 
● Status = Complete but only once every single line of the order has been shipped
● There can be multiple financial invoice numbers for a single order
● We should show the financial invoice number on the order detail page if we can => Keep for V2 
The statuses should be updated on the order history tables and the order detail page, and it's valid for eShop & external (QAD) orders --> See the first 2 screenshots
 
 
 
Expected order refresh logic:

● Orders should be refreshed every hour
● We should only refresh orders that are marked as confirmed

User Stories: 

Source of the video**



 
As a publisher, I should be able to choose bewteen different sources when adding a video :
 * 


● 
    ◦ Streamed from Youtube or Business video
● 
    ◦ Directly loaded to Drupal 8 only if streaming features are possible AL: we can use Media module to choose which media to select (youtube or video)

Video display settings**



 
As a publisher, I should be able to configure the video display settings :
 * 


● 
    ◦ change the auto generated image with a specific thumbnail**
● 
    ◦ configure a size for the video display, depending on whether some text is displayed or not, or if the element is on a narrow page or a full width page ...
● 
    ◦ allow or not full size video
● 
    ◦ hide or display video display settings for the user

Video player settings



 
As a publisher, I should be able to set up in the Back-office the video player settings :
 * set up the start of the video at a very precise moment, by specifying the timecode.


● set up the start and stop of the video if the user is scrolling up or down.
● set up the automatic start of the video in mute mode when the user is opening the page.
● set up the YouTube's "Enable privacy-enhanced mode" option.
● display the replay at the end of the video instead of related videos.
● show or hide video player controls.
● show or hide Iframe borders*.*

Accessibility features**



 
As a publisher, I should be able to configure accessibility features for users who would need it (in an inclusive approach and to improve SEO referencing) :
 * add, edit and remove a name for a video


● add, edit and remove metatags
● add, edit and remove subtitles and legend
● add, edit and remove video transcription

Layout of the video in the block



 
As a publisher, I should be able to define precisely where to display the elements inside the block :
 * have the possibility to automatically size the video according to the size of the block



Mobile : 

Full screen Video with automatic screen rotation

User Stories:

As a publisher, I want to solicit interest in blogs or newsletters to my users by building a form ....

The publisher should be able to build the webform with a Webform Builder :
● edit, add or remove webform fields.
● edit, add or remove the text inside the webform (use of a WYSIWYG editor).
● design easily the form (text color and transformations, size of the fields, background-color, design of the "Submit" button).
● add, edit or remove the notification text or the "Submit" button text.
● modify the redirection URL or notifications after submit.

Form content
● Text : Title to provide a clear description of the offer, and what the user is signing up to.
● Email address field : <input type = "email"> with label.
● GDPR consent checkbox : <input type = "checkbox"> with label and some text with URL link possible to explain the gdpr consent.
● Submit button : <input type = "submit"> with a designed button to send the form.
● 
● Hidden field (optional) Items of interest field : If relevant an hidden filled pre-filled with any relevant information (to be specified by the business during the phase of setup).

Data validation check
● a red asterisk should identify mandatory fields.
● all fields are mandatory (email address and gdpr consent).
● the email address must be valid.
● In the case of non-conformity while submitting the form, an error message must notify clearly how the user can correct his inputs (summary and highlight of the inputs to correct).

... displayed in a block element.

The publisher should be able to
● design a block or replicate the design of any existing block on the website.
● add or remove the Newsletter subscription block in any page, according to the business specifications.

Then I will capture the user as a lead and send the promise Newsletter to the subscriber .

The publisher should be able to capture easily the user as a lead, track some information and provide the newsletter to the subscriber :
● edit, add or remove the mapping between the fields of the Newsletter subscription block and Salesforce, GetResponse or other (from where the newsletter is designed and sent)
● access to the leads via the back-office.
● consult in a dedicated area of the Back-Office the list of subscribers. The publisher should be able to export this list in a csv file.
● add, edit of remove GTM tags to track the user activity, according to business specifications.

***************************************************

Pre-conditions:
● The Newsletter subscription block can be displayed in any page of the site, according to the specifications of the business during the setup phase.
● This block invites the user to subscribe to a newsletter by entering his email address and giving his consent to gdpr.

Basic Flow

As a user, I'm highly interested in blogs and information from the website, so I'd like to subscribe to the Newsletter
● Scenario 1

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) does not fill in the form

THEN nothing happens during his navigation and he will not be registered in the subscribers list.
● Scenario 2

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) submit the form with a correct address email AND gdpr consent given

THEN  a message should notify him that he has successfully subscribed to the newsletter.
● Scenario 3

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) submit the form with a mandatory input missing (incorrect email format OR missing tick in the GDPR consent checkbox)

THEN an error message is displayed in red and the fields to correct are highlighted.

Post conditions
● A notification text is displayed after submitting, informing the user that he has successfully subscribed to the newsletter.
● The user is automatically added to the list of subscribers and receives in his inbox the newsletters when they are sent by the system (Salesforce, GetResponse...)

Mobile:

Same as desktop requirements for website user and publisher. Responsive.

column5: [eShop] Easy way to login for B2B buyer to eShop
column7:
User Story


● Create a welcom page
● Develop custom login page with the login component.{}

 

As a B2B buyer 
I want to have ability for easy login to eShop 
So that I can do not lost access


Acceptance Criteria
● The system will support access to eShop with Login and password
● Login will have email format (test@test.com)
● The system will support 'forgot password' functionality- Login page will look like [TBD]
● General comment: we need to use the Poppins font https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Poppins
● Header: Back to website link: https://www.business.com/
● Hero br, technical information, key information to know us better, a word from our CEO, discovery about us, FAQ: All these sections need to be administrable by business, meaning they should be autonomous to change the content (images, videos, text...) so please include this in the userguide (for video I remember you said we can only change the YouTube ID, not the URL itself)
● Login pop up: Display standard SF error message as we cannot change this, we can only change the styling

 

Scenarios


 
Scenario 1:
GIVEN B2B buyer with access to eShop
WHEN B2B buyer goes to Login page --> inputs her/his correct login and password --> clicks on login button
THEN B2B buyer gets access to eShop





 
Scenario 2:
GIVEN B2B buyer with access to eShop
WHEN B2B buyer goes to Login page --> inputs her/his INcorrect login and/or password --> clicks on login button
THEN system display error message

Actual result: 

1. We have variations grouped under parent
2. We do not see the price for parent when there are variations => Linked to point 1
3. We do not see the size => Linked to point 1
4. We have this information
    a. Minimum quantity is X
    b. Maximum quantity is X
    c. Sold in increments of X 
Expected result:

1. We should NOT group variations under parent => Serhiy is working on it, he will reload the product file to UAT today 28/07 in        CODEExx-xxx   
2. We should see the price directly => I think this will be fixed with point 1
3. We saw with Dev that when we do not group variations under parent (point 1) we have a new field called SKU Variant that appears automatically on the product card, we need to hide the label SKU Variant with CSS and just display the size
4. We should have this information somewhere on the product card
    a. SKU 
    b. Sold in increments of X => Already there

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR 

1. In the menu, we need to add a new page called: NEW ORDER => Screenshot 1
2. On this new page, we should have => Screenshot 2
● Quick add component at the top
● Product component => This one is administrable by business so they can change the title and place whichever SKU they want
● Recent orders component
● Hero br => Check the comments 
3. We need to rename the existing page called ORDERS to XXX => PO can you please confirm the name? => Screenshot 1 
 
 
Screenshot 1
 
             
 
 
 
Screenshot 2
Populate Discount field in salesforce on the order when percent promotion is applied and send this field value to QAD to the discount field

User 1  
 
As discussed with you on Slack:

● VAT = tax for domestic orders
● QAD is the master data, it can only calculate this value once the order is created in QAD
● So we cannot show this value on the checkout summary since order is not created in QAD yet

******************************************

User Stories: 

As a user, I should be able to navigate throughout different pages of a specific category.

As a publisher, I should be able to
● customize the order in the taxonomy. By default, it will follow the order of taxonomy.
● hide item on the secondary menu

********************************************

Pre-conditions:

Desktop: 

The secondary menu can be added on category details page. It allows the user to navigate through the pages related to one category.

Background color is white. The text will be left aligned.
 Background is grey to reflects the cue for the page selected and the related menu is expanded.
 When you click on the "+" the section will also be grey.

The secondary menu is composed by:
● A one column list based on taxonomy
● Each time a new item is added in a specific taxonomy, it should reflect on the menu
● Each item on the menu is linked to its related content page
● The items are ordered by taxonomy.

Mobile: 

No secondary menu in mobile

********************************************

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario 1: Secondary menu Presence

As anonymous user or a logged in user
 When I'm on a category page,
 Then I can see the secondary menu on the left of the page, with the background in white color and the text in left justified

Scenario 2: Secondary menu Expansion

As anonymous user or a logged in user
 When I'm on a category page,
 And When I'm clicking on the "+"
 Then I can see the sub-levels associated with the related category

Mobile

No secondary menu in mobile

******************************************

User Stories: 

As a website user, I should be able to see the essentially stories that will help to understand the products, services and value proposition.

As a publisher, the goal of this section is to showcase the essentially stories that will help to understand the products, services and value proposition.

The publisher should be able to add, modify or delete the content or change the background. The publisher should be able to add, remove or change the images.

The publisher should be able to use these elements in different part of the site. 

********************************************

Pre-conditions:

Desktop : 

This section will be divided in two parts:
● Left Part (1/3 of the block):
    ◦ An image (pulled from the teaser images of the related page, possibility to add several images)
● Right Part (2/3 of the block):
    ◦ Background - Grey
    ◦ Should have a Title (pulled from the title of the related page)
    ◦ A blue line
    ◦ Followed by descriptive text in regular font (pulled from the teaser description of the related page)
    ◦ A customizable CTA Text to the full story - on click it should open the respective page
    ◦ A carousel slider on the bottom right corner of the block if there are multiple images, else don’t display the slider

Mobile: 

This section will be composed by:
● An image
● Followed by Title
● Background – Grey
● A blue line
● Followed by descriptive text in regular font
● A customizable CTA Text to the full story - on click it should open the respective page
● Dashed lines – The Dashed lines should be placed below the image where the number of dash will represent the number of images.
    ◦ Color – grey
    ◦ The color should change to orange for a particular dash when user is one that number of image. For example, when the user is on the second image, the second dash should be in orange color.

********************************************

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario 1 : Build and display of the Expert spotlight block
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure the Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add, edit or remove all the content in this section.
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure the Expert spotlight block,
● And When I don't add any content,
● Then I shouldn't be able to see the block on the front page.

 
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure the page where I want to display the Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to display as many different stories as desired by the business.

 

Scenario 2 : Header of the Expert spotlight block
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add, edit or remove the title as defined by the business.

 

Scenario 3 : Expert spotlight block's content
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add, edit or remove the image associated to a story.
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add or edit the title of the story.
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add or edit the description of the sotry in a rich text editor.
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to add or edit URL link inviting the user to read the story (text of the link and page or component of destination).
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When clicking on the URL inviting me to read the story,
● Then I should be redirected to the page or to the component where I can read the story.

Scenario 4 : Display of a unique story or of several stories in a carousel
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to choose the most relevant story displayed in the page.

 
● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● And When several stories are relevant to display under one category (title in the header)
● Then I should be able to choose the stories in order to display them in a carousel.

 
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When several stories are displayed under one category
● Then I should be able to navigate between the different stories by using the carousel selector.

 
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When several stories are displayed under one category
● And When I'm at the last item, if I click on the right arrow again,
● Then I should be able to see the first item of the list, it will be a loop

 
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When only one story is displayed under a category
● Then a carousel should not be displayed in the image.

Same as Desktop but related to a mobile (touching and not clicking...)

The design is different : vertical rather than horizontal display.

The scenario 4 of the desktop version is replaced by the scenario below :

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,
● Then I should be able to choose the most relevant story displayed in the page.

● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure a Expert spotlight block,

● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When several stories are displayed under one category
● Then I should be able to navigate between the different stories by using the dashed lines selector.
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When navigating through the dashed lines selector,

● When reading the content in the Expert spotlight block,
● And When only one story is displayed under a category

Solution 1: We need to make this link not have an expiration date, that is the best solution. Or at least increase it to 7 days.
 
 
 
Solution 2: If we cannot implement solution 1 then we have to update the content for the welcome email template so customers know they only have 24 hours, the changes are in red

Context: 

● We are integrated with the QAD WEB UI as there is no standard API and we do not have any active monitoring in place, just some logs and notifications when the integration breaks. 
 
 
Goal:

● We need to create a script that will automatically test the QAD WEB UI at a specified frequency, to ensure we can submit a full sales order without issue. 
 
 
Specifications:

● We should make the frequency settings manageable if we want to change it in the future.
● We need this script to run on  UAT which is connected to QAD TEST, I'm not sure we can run it on business PROD which is connected to QAD PROD but if it's possible to do without actually creating a sales order let's do it.
● This script should hit all the QAD WEB UI end points that we need to successfully create a sales order, please check the documentation link I put below where I started listing what I know.
● Once the script is executed, we need to send an email template to a distribution list where we can manage the emails of the people it should be sent to as some people can leave the project and new team members can come. We do not need to make the email templates beautiful like the ones we send to customer and customer service, just some text is fine. There are 3 scenarios that I can think of:
    ◦ The script runs and no errors are detected (scenario 1)
    ◦ The script runs and some errors are detected (scenario 2)
    ◦ The script is not able to run (scenario 3) 
 
 
Email templates:

● For testing please configure your email and projet manager's: exemple@email.com    
● Scenario 1: If the script runs and no errors are detected, automatically send the below email:
    ◦ Subject: Business QAD Script - SUCCESS
    ◦ Body: The script ran as expected and no errors were detected.
● Scenario 2: If the script runs and errors are detected, automatically send the below email:
    ◦ Subject: Business QAD Script - ERRORS
    ◦ Body: The script ran as expected but some errors were detected. The integration between Salesforce and QAD could be down, please investigate on priority. [Is it possible to list the error logs here?]
● Scenario 3: If the script is not able to run, automatically send the below email:
    ◦ Subject: Business QAD Script - UNABLE TO RUN
    ◦ Body: The script was unable to run as pld, please investigate.

******************************************
 
User Stories: 
 
The table data component allows the consultation of free standing tables.
 
As a user, I I should be able to comfortably consult data table that provides me rich and interesting content, wherever it's relevant in the website.
● Even if the full table is extending beyond the standard screen size, the table should be responsive and the content should be easily readable (see Description (Mobile)) 
Location of the table data
 
As a publisher, I should be able to display a table data in any page of the site where it's relevant, as defined by the business.

● The Table of data can be used in the Benefits & Specifications component of the product page
● The Table of data should also be available in the editorial page (page builder).
● The Table of data should be used in any page of the website if required. 
 Type of component for the table data
 
 As a publisher, I should be able to use the table data as a standalone element or embed into an existing component
 
 The data table can be used in either type, whichever is most relevant on the page as defined by the business.
 
 Format of the table data
 
 As a publisher, I should be able to define easily, in the back-office of the website, the format of the table
 
 By using a WYSIWYG rich editor, the publisher should be able to : 

● Add a table by choosing the number of columns and the number of rows
● Edit the table
● Remove the table
● Add or edit the type of the table data (single-entry table or double-entry table) for the responsive features
● Add or remove a numbering column
● Add or remove a header line
● Add or remove a header column
● Freeze the header line or not
● Freeze the header column or not
● Add a column before
● Add a colum after
● Cut a column from the table
● Copy a column in the table
● Paste a column in the table
● Delete a column
● Add a row above
● Add a row below
● Cut a row from the table
● Copy a row in the table
● Paste a row in the table
● Delete a row
● Define or edit the width of the columns
● Define or edit the height of the cells
● Automatically adapt the width of the columns or the height of the rows to the size of the cell content, if desired 
Format of the text
 
As a publisher, I should be able to define easily, in the back-office of the website, the format of the texte in the table data
 
By using a WYSIWYG rich editor, the publisher should be able to : 

● Define the alignment of the text in the cell (align left, center, align right)
● Define the color of the text
● Define the size of the text
● Define the transformation on the text (italic, bold, underline)
● Define the font of the text
● Use or remove bullet lists or numbered lists
● Use supercripts and subscripts 
 
 
Format of the cells
 
 As a publisher, I should be able to work easily, in the back-office of the website, on the cells of the table data
 
 By using a WYSIWYG rich editor, the publisher should be able to : 

● Define the background color of the cell
● Add, edit or remove files or images
● Add, edit or remove URL Link
● Merge the cells
● Dissociate the cells
● Define the borders of the cell: position, color, style, width
● Add, edit or remove cells which can be sorted 
Mobile:
 
The table data component allows the consultation of mobile friendly free standing tables.
 
 As a user, I I should be able to comfortably consult on my mobile device data table that provides me rich and interesting content, wherever it's relevant in the website
 
 
 
Behaviour of the Table data component :
 
Single entry table
 
Conversion of an horizontal table into a vertical single column
 
The table header (1st line) must be used as a label for each item in each row
 
 
 becomes
 
  
 
NB: JS Enabled table handling that will use the column as a label for each item in each row making it possible to convert a horizontal table into a vertical single column.
 
Double entry table
 
the table header AND the 1st column are fixed and remain visible on the screen as the user scrolls across horizontally or vertically.
 
 As a user, I I should be able to comfortably consult tables on mobile devices.
 
As a publisher, I should be able to use or to turn off the component on a page and/or a tab component. I should also be able to determine whether it is being used in the case of a single or double entry table.
 
 ****************************************************
 
Pre-conditions:
 
Desktop : 
 
The table data builder should be a WYSIWYG rich editor, allowing to add rich content to the table and design easily this component.
 
 
 
Mobile: 
 
Same as Desktop for publisher in the built and for users, but related to a mobile (touching and not clicking, swiping instead of scrolling ...).
 
The focus has to be done on the responsiveness of the table data.
 
********************************************
 
Acceptance Criteria:

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website, in the section of the back-office where I can configure the Table data component,
● Then I should be able to add, edit or remove content or design the table via a Wysiwyg rich editor. 
 

● As an anonymous user or logged in user,
● When going into the website,
● Then I should be able to comfortably consult the content of a data table, regardless of the device used. 
 

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the back-office of the website,
● And When it's relevant for the business,
● Then I should be able to add, edit or a Table Data component in any page or any type of compatible component of the website. 
 ** 

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website in the back-office
● Then I should be able to add, edit or remove a table data as a standalone element OR add, edit or remove a table data as part of an existing compatible component. 
 ** 

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website in the back-office where I can build and design a table data,
● Then I should be able to do all the table forUser 2ing actions described in the section above. 
 ** 

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website in the back-office where I can build and design a table data,
● Then I should be able to do all the text forUser 2ing actions described in the section above. 
 

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website in the back-office where I can build and design a table data,
● Then I should be able to do all the cells forUser 2ing actions described in the section above. 
Mobile:

● As an anonymous user or logged in user,
● When going into the website,
● Then I should be able to comfortably consult the content of a data table, regardless of the device used. 
Scenario 1: The full table is readable inside the standard screen size OR the Table data feature is disabled

● As an anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website, on a page with a table which content is fully readable on my screen,
● Then nothing happens when I scroll across 
Scenario 2: The full single entry table is extending beyond the standard screen size and the Table data feature is enabled

● As an anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website, on a page with a single table entry which content is not entirely readable on my screen,
● Then the table is automatically converted into a vertical single column. 
Scenario 3: The full double entry table is extending beyond the standard screen size and the Table data feature is enabled

● *As*an anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website, on a page with a double table entry which content is not entirely readable on my screen,
● Then the 1st column and the 1st line of the table are fixed and I can scroll across horizontally to read all the content. 
**********************************************************
 
GTM Tracking
 
 Preconditions:
 
As a publisher, I should be able to track where the visitor of the website has clicked in the tableAs a publisher, I should be able to consult this data in a datalayer checker.
 
  
 
Acceptance criteria :

● As a Publisher,
● When going into the website in the back-office,
● Then I should be able to track where the user has clicked inside the table data by adding GTM tags.

As a user, I should be able to get in touch easily with the business team, without opening my email box and wherever I am when I'm scrolling.

onClick

● Hidden field in the form : populated based on the current (active page)

Contact us - Sticky side button : Collapsed

User Stories: 

As a user, I should be able to get in touch easily with the business team, without opening my email box and wherever I am when I'm scrolling.

As a business team member, I want to make it easy for my visitor to contact me, wherever he is in a page of the website.

As a publisher, I should be able to:
● add or remove a Contact us - Sticky side button on a page.
● add, edit or remove the content of the collapsed button.
● override the default text-color or background-color for an alternative color if desired by the business.
● configure the type of content which is relevant on the page when the button is expanded.

The text field should be a rich text editor, allowing to add and transform text, images and URL links.

 ********************************************

Pre-conditions:

Desktop : 

Pre-conditions
● The Contact us - Sticky side button is visible and usable by any user (anonymous user and logged in user)
● The Contact us - Sticky side button should be visible on any page of the site, as long as it has been defined.
● Different floating sticky side button may be applied to various parts of the site.

Appearance of the button
● By default, the background-color of the button is blue (#0E4E95). But a different background-color can specified as time of setup.
● By default, the text-color is white (#FFFFFF). But a different text-color can specified as time of setup.

● access to the leads via the back-office.
● If no integration with Salesforce, an email should be sent to the business (rules and email template to be defined during the setup by the business).
● add, edit of remove GTM tags to track the user activity, as defined by the business during setup.

Pre conditions

Desktop:
● A user wants to view or download one or more contents (brochure, datasheet ...) :
● Download of one content --> Click on the Download button associated to the document
● Download of several documents --> Tick the "Select" box and click on the link "Download Selected".
● View of a document→ click on the "Preview" button in order to see the document.
● If at least one content associated is flagged as "request data", then the click on the Download button or "Preview button" triggers immediately the CTA Pop-up.
● The CTA Pop-up invite the visitor to give email address and GDPR consent

Basic Flow

As a user, I want to preview or download some content made available on the site.
● Scenario 1

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) does not fill in the form and close the CTA Pop-up

THEN the link to download or preview the consent is not sent AND the CTA Pop-up is closed.
● Scenario 2

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) submit the form with a correct address email AND gdpr consent given

THEN a message should inform him that he will immediately receive a link to open or download the document requested.
● Scenario 3

IF the user (anonymous or logged in) submit the form with a mandatory input missing (incorrect email format OR missing tick in the GDPR consent checkbox)

THEN an error message is displayed in red and the fields to correct are highlighted.

Post conditions

A notification text is displayed after submitting, informing the user that he will immediately receive in his inbox a link to open or download the content(s) requested.

Acceptance Criteria
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website and requesting to review or download a content

● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When I submit the form with all mandatory fields correctly filled in
● Then I will receive by email a link on which I can click to open or download the document requested
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website and requesting to review or download a content
● And When the CTA Pop-up is displayed on my screen,
● And When I click on the cross in the top-right corner of the CTA Pop-up
● Then the CTA Pop-up is closed.
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website and requesting to review or download a content
● And When I submit the form without having fill in correctly all the mandatory fields marked with a red asterisk
● Then the incorrect or missing fields are highlighted, and an error message is displayed, showing me where I need to correct my inputs.
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When I submit the form with all mandatory fields correctly filled in
● And When I see a notification with a link on which I can click to open or download the document requested.
● And When I click on the link provided,
● Then I can see on my screen or download on my device the required content.

● User can click any page link to navigate to the corresponding level.
● '/' are not clickable ans it should be blue.

Breadcrumbs should be configured automatically using the architecture of the site

In some cases if a breadcrumb is not accurately auto generated it may need modification by an admin.

No breadcrumbs on Mobile

Placeholder : e.g. ‘Product A’ or ‘REF’ or ‘How can I ..?’

When I click on the searchbar, I can write my request. 
As soon as I've written 4 letters, an autocomplete functionality is displayed. 

 

Autocomplete is separated into 4 areas, always displayed in the following order : 
1> "Show all [ x ] results" ( x = total number of result considering every content)

2 > In product ( x )  ( x = total number of results within product content type )

3>  In content ( x ) ( x = total number of results within all the content except product e and documents  )

4>  In documents ( x ) ( x = total number of results within the documents )

 

In each of this area :

→ We display 2 results max 
→ The first item displayed is the most relevant

→ If no results are found for one category (ex document) , this category is not displayed 

--> If no results as find in all the categories, the autocomplete display "No results" and it's not clickable

    ◦ add, edit or remove pre-filled hidden fields in order to Optimize search on search engines
    ◦ add, edit or remove all SEO improvement techniques (metatags, ...) as defined by the business team
    ◦ Tracking measurements :
● add, edit or remove measurement tools (as GTM tags) for click rate
● add, edit or remove tracking on the number of times a person watches the video
● add, edit or remove tracking of the moment when the user stops watching the video
● Facilitated sharing on social networks, in order to increase brand visibility and impact
    ◦ add, edit or remove video sharing features on social networks or by email
    ◦ hide or display the option allowing the user to subscribe to the brand's chl on Youtube videos

Source of the video

 
As a publisher, I should be able to choose bewteen different sources when adding a video : 


 
● Streamed from Youtube 
 
 
● Directly loaded to Drupal 8 only if streaming features are possible AL: we can use Media module to choose which media to select (youtube or video)

Video display settings**

 

 
As a publisher, I should be able to configure the video display settings :

● change the auto generated image with a specific thumbnail**

 
● configure a size for the video display, depending on whether some text is displayed or not, or if the element is on a narrow page or a full width page ...
● allow or not full size video
● hide or display video display settings for the user

 

 
As a user, I should be able to select between different sizes when I watch the video, if available :

● select the size of the video if this option is displayed (full screen for example)

 

Video player settings

 

 
As a publisher, I should be able to set up in the Back-office the video player settings :

● add, edit or remove the manual launch of the video by clicking on a "Watch video" icon.

 
● set up the start of the video at a very precise moment, by specifying the timecode.
● set up the start and stop of the video if the user is scrolling up or down.
● set up the automatic start of the video in mute mode when the user is opening the page.
● set up the YouTube's "Enable privacy-enhanced mode" option.
● display the replay at the end of the video instead of related videos.
● show or hide video player controls.
● show or hide Iframe borders*.*

Accessibility features**

 

 
As a publisher, I should be able to configure accessibility features for users who would need it (in an inclusive approach and to improve SEO referencing) :

● add, edit and remove a name for a video

 
● add, edit and remove metatags
● add, edit and remove subtitles and legend
● add, edit and remove video transcription

Layout of the video in the block

 

 
As a publisher, I should be able to define precisely where to display the elements inside the block :

● have the possibility to automatically size the video according to the size of the block

 
● define the alignement between the video and the other elements : top, bottom, right, left

Elements of the block

 

 
As a publisher, I want to build and design the block itself, and its components, with a maximum of flexibility

● entirely build and design the Video block in the Back-Office of the website

 
● display the Video block as a stand-alone component, or as a part of another component (Technical expertise needed : relevant to use the iFrame display ?), AL : We can use iframe or media embed mysiwyg
● display the Video block in any page or in any component of a page, as defined with the business during the setup phase.
● add, edit and remove the Video block
● adjust the size of the block
● design (with css styles or classes) the elements of the block (size, text-alignment, position of the elements, composition of the block ...

Nota bene : Except for the video, all other elements are optional and can be used independently
● Video Header (Text) : add, edit or remove - choice to display or hide
● Sub-Title (Text) : add, edit or remove - choice to display or hide
● Description : add, edit or remove - choice to display or hide
● URL Link : add, edit or remove - choice to display or hide
● Images (logo, small picture or thumbnail) : add, edit or remove - choice to display or hide
● Video: add, edit the settings, remove
● Multiple video block:
● 
    ◦ 
        ■ add, edit, remove
● 
    ◦ 
        ■ apply styles on the component to display the videos in tabs
● 
    ◦ 
        ■ order the videos

Whenever it is possible, the publisher should have at its disposal a rich text editor (WYSIWYG editor).

*****************************************

Pre-conditions:

Desktop : 

A video block is a block providing to the user a video at the most relevant areas on the website.

This Video block is composed with a video player, and other elements defined by the business.

The main idea behind building a custom component  is to give to the publisher the ability to change videos property attributes without having access to the code.

Mobile: 

The video should be responsive. 

********************************************

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario 1: 
● As a publisher
● When I consult tracking and SEO referencing tools
● Then I can have all the information I have set up in the site to follow its consultation

Scenario 2:
● As a publisher
● When I configure the pages of the website in the Back-Office
● Then I can easily choose which type of Video block I want to use, depending on the location or the situation

Scenario 3:
● As a publisher
● When I configure the Video block in the Back-Office
● Then I can choose between different streaming sources for my video without constraints

Scenario 4:
● As a publisher
● When I build the Video block in the Back-Office
● Then I can configure the video display settings described above without having to modify the source code.

Scenario 5:
● As an anonymous or logged in user,
● When I watch a video on the player,
● Then I have the ability to define the size of my video via settings, if available.

Scenario 6:
● As a publisher
● When I build the Video block in the Back-Office
● and When  ** I set up the Video player in the Back-Office
● Then  ** I can configure the video player settings and modify the properties attributes (described above) without having to do it in the source code.

Scenario 7: 
● As a publisher
● When I build the Video block in the Back-Office
● and When I set up the Video player in the Back-Office
● Then I can configure accessibility features (described above) without having to do that in the source code.

Scenario 8:
● As a publisher
● When I build the Video block in the Back-Office,
● Then I can easily customize the location of each element inside this block, as described above.

Scenario 9: 
● As a publisher
● When I want to buid and design the Video block according to the business wishes 
● Then I can do all the configurations, described above, directly in the Back-Office, in a custom component.

Mobile:

Scenario 10:
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website on my mobile device
● Then the display of the site automatically adapts to the resolution of my screen

Scenario 11:
● As anonymous user or a logged in user
● When going into the website on my mobile device
● And When I turn my mobile in landscape mode, while watching a video
● And When the automatic rotation screen is activated on my mobile
● Then the video is displayed in full screen.
